title: The top tennis players, and moments, of 2024
description: Sinner and Sabalenka each won two Grand Slams and ended up No. 1 -- but 2024 was full of memorable moments.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: 'I can one day tell my grandkids that I played Rafa': Nadal retires, with an unreachable legacy
description: Rafael Nadal retires on Tuesday at the Davis Cup, after more than 20 years in pro tennis -- and with a record on clay that might never be surpassed.
author: Tom Hamilton

title: Tennis, gaming & fashion collide as Medvedev, Lacoste unveil Medvedev Court
description: Daniil Medvedev and Lacoste recently announced the unveiling of the all-new Daniil Medvedev Court in Grasse, France. The project is a part of the 'We are Etendart' movement, which promotes the development of young people through an educational approach based on sport, creative arts and the power of inspiration. Novak Djokovic and Venus Williams are among other superstars who have previously joined the 'We are Etendart' movement. The Medvedev court, located roughly 40 kilometres west of Nice, France, was inspired by the 28-year-old‚Äôs love for gaming. Featuring vibrant blue and green colours, the Medvedev court will offer a new gateway for young players to easily embrace tennis. When gaming, tennis, and fashion collide üêä Introducing the first-ever @DaniilMedwed Court in Grasse, France! üéæ Blending his passion for gaming with tennis, this court opens up exciting opportunities for young players to fall in love with the sport. ‚ú® @Lacoste | #partner pic.twitter.com/HFIJAu2eBP ‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) December 9, 2024 [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Sinner meets Verstappen, waves chequered flag at F1 race in Abu Dhabi
description: Jannik Sinner ended the 2024 ATP Tour season by lifting the Nitto ATP Finals trophy and on Sunday, the Italian helped bring the Formula 1 year to a close. Sinner waved the chequered flag at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, the final race of the F1 season. It was an action-packed weekend for the World No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings, who also spent time with renowned driver Max Verstappen and attended the F2/F3 Prize-Giving event. Jannik Sinner attends the F2/F3 Prize-Giving event. Credit: Formula Motorsport Limited Sinner was not the only tennis star in attendance. Grigor Dimitrov, Arthur Cazaux, Aryna Sabalenka, Paula Badosa, Elena Rybakina and Sorana Cirstea also enjoyed their time in Abu Dhabi. Dimitrov shared on his Instagram story a picture of him with actress Eva Longoria. Arthur Cazaux at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. Credit: Arthur Cazaux Earlier this season, Sinner met driver Carlos Sainz in Monte-Carlo, where the Spaniard sat courtside to watch the 23-year-old. Drivers George Russell and Lando Norris also attended the clay-court ATP Masters 1000 event this past April. Hey Jannik! üëã World No. 1 ranked tennis star @janniksin joins us for the season finale in Abu Dhabi! üéæ#F1 #AbuDhabiGP pic.twitter.com/HJtAfSQcn3 ‚Äî Formula 1 (@F1) December 8, 2024 [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Why Raducanu is giving herself a 'pat on the back' for 2024
description: Emma Raducanu spent 2024 trying to rebuild after missing a year through injury - BBC Sport analyses how her season panned out.

title: Kyrgios to make Grand Slam return in Australia
description: After a series of injuries, Nick Kyrgios uses his protected ranking to secure a place in the main draw of January's Australian Open.

title: Sinner Cruises to ATP Finals Victory
description: Jannik Sinner is the 2024 Nitto ATP finals champion after comfortably defeating Taylor Fritz 6-4 6-4 in Sunday‚Äôs final, becoming the first player from his country to win the tournament in its 55-year history. The Italian emerges as the undefeated champion (without even dropping a set) and wins $4,881,100 in prize money, making it a ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: ATP Finals 2024 Semi Finals Recap
description: Jannik Sinner and Taylor Fritz will face off in Sunday‚Äôs 2024 ATP finals decider after the pair came through their sem-final matches at the Pala Alpitour in Turin. Fritz was the first man to book his spot. He defeated Alexander Zverev for the fourth time this season, battling to a 6-3 3-6 7-6(3) win. It ‚Ä¶
